intro: Lichterveldia, commonly known as the red-flowered bell heather, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Lichterveldia thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
